channel.title: 关于dead drop和piratebox
channel.description:
情报秘密放置点 (Dead drop)
查看全部 死投或死信箱是间谍交易的一种方法，用于使用秘密位置在两个人之间传递物品或信息。通过避免直接开会，个人可以维护操作安全性。这种方法与所谓的实时下落是相反的，所谓的实时下落是因为两个人见面以交换物品或信息。众所周知，间谍及其处理人员会使用各种技术执行死掉的下落，以隐藏物品并发出下落信号。 维基百科（英文) https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dead_drop
A PirateBox is a portable electronic device, often consisting of a Wi-Fi router and a device for storing information, creating a wireless network that allows users who are connected to share files anonymously and locally. By design, this device is disconnected from the Internet. https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/PirateBox

item.title: 关于dead drop和piratebox
item.dc:creator: adt
item.description:
情报秘密放置点 (Dead drop)

查看全部
死投或死信箱是间谍交易的一种方法，用于使用秘密位置在两个人之间传递物品或信息。通过避免直接开会，个人可以维护操作安全性。这种方法与所谓的实时下落是相反的，所谓的实时下落是因为两个人见面以交换物品或信息。众所周知，间谍及其处理人员会使用各种技术执行死掉的下落，以隐藏物品并发出下落信号。 维基百科（英文)

en.m.wikipedia.org

Dead drop

A dead drop or dead letter box is a method of espionage tradecraft used to pass items or information between two individuals (e.g., a case officer and an agent, or two agents) using a secret location. By avoiding direct meetings, individuals can maintain operational security. This method stands in contrast to the live drop, so-called because two persons meet to exchange items or information. Spies and their handlers have been known to perform dead drops using various techniques to hide items (s...

A PirateBox is a portable electronic device, often consisting of a Wi-Fi router and a device for storing information, creating a wireless network that allows users who are connected to share files anonymously and locally. By design, this device is disconnected from the Internet.

en.m.wikipedia.org

PirateBox

A PirateBox is a portable electronic device, often consisting of a Wi-Fi router and a device for storing information, creating a wireless network that allows users who are connected to share files anonymously and locally. By design, this device is disconnected from the Internet. The PirateBox was originally designed to exchange data freely under the public domain or under a free license. The PirateBox was designed in 2011 by David Darts, a professor at the Steinhardt School of Culture, Educat...
